alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Carroll County through 230 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coila, or near Black Hawk, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... North Carrollton and Malmaison around 230 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Carrollton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
